intro: Galium sherardiiflorum, commonly known as the Sierra grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. It produces clusters of tiny white or pink flowers, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Galium sherardiiflorum is often found in moist meadows and along streambanks, thriving in well-drained soils.
